Issues.Title: NullReferenceException when calling StateHasChanged from Javascript
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/mrpmorris/blazor-fluxor/tree/feature/flight-finder-demo

1. Install Redux Tools extension for Chrome 
2. Run the FlightFinder sample
3. Open Dev Tools
4. Click Search
5: Add a flight to the short list
6: Flick through the time line in the Dev Tools

This will trigger a callback that will invoke StateHasChanged. At this point a NullReferenceException is encountered...

```
MonoPlatform.ts:70 Uncaught Error: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
  at FlightFinder.Client.Components.Shortlist.BuildRenderTree (:59912/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.RenderTree.RenderTreeBuilder builder) <0x1e07e88 + 0x00058> in <5589bddb96e64f64bb0e27875fbeec39>:0 
  at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Rendering.ComponentState.RenderIntoBatch (:59912/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Rendering.RenderBatchBuilder batchBuilder, Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.RenderFragment renderFragment) <0x1b91b70 + 0x0006c> in <72270648a3b54698885c6ba1c18107cc>:0 
  at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Rendering.Renderer.RenderInExistingBatch (:59912/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Rendering.RenderQueueEntry renderQueueEntry) <0x1b91718 + 0x00040> in <72270648a3b54698885c6ba1c18107cc>:0 
  at :59912/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Rendering.Renderer.ProcessRenderQueue () <0x1b90e20 + 0x00048> in <72270648a3b54698885c6ba1c18107cc>:0 
  at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Rendering.Renderer.AddToRenderQueue (:59912/System.Int32 componentId, Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.RenderFragment renderFragment) <0x1b8dcf8 + 0x00068> in <72270648a3b54698885c6ba1c18107cc>:0 
  at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Components.RenderHandle.Render (:59912/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.RenderFragment renderFragment) <0x1b8d9e0 + 0x00036> in <72270648a3b54698885c6ba1c18107cc>:0 
  at :59912/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Components.BlazorComponent.StateHasChanged () <0x1b8d8e8 + 0x00048> in <72270648a3b54698885c6ba1c18107cc>:0 
  at Blazor.Fluxor.Feature`1+<>c[TState].<TriggerStateChangedCallbacks>b__15_0 (:59912/System.Action callback) <0x1fe7048 + 0x00010> in <23c61ea74e5f4ee4afc2e800c444bbfe>:0 
  at System.Collections.Generic.List`1[T].ForEach (:59912/System.Action`1[T] action) <0x1b49f90 + 0x00054> in <a02c7d9644e84620838bef876532992f>:0

  at Blazor.Fluxor.Feature`1[TState].RestoreState (:59912/System.Object value) <0x20f5420 + 0x00018> in <23c61ea74e5f4ee4afc2e800c444bbfe>:0 
  at Blazor.Fluxor.ReduxDevTools.ReduxDevToolsMiddleware.OnJumpToState (:59912/System.Object sender, Blazor.Fluxor.ReduxDevTools.CallbackObjects.JumpToStateCallback e) <0x2051f28 + 0x00156> in <23c61ea74e5f4ee4afc2e800c444bbfe>:0 
  at Blazor.Fluxor.ReduxDevTools.ReduxDevToolsInterop.OnJumpToState (:59912/Blazor.Fluxor.ReduxDevTools.CallbackObjects.JumpToStateCallback jumpToStateCallback) <0x2051868 + 0x00020> in <23c61ea74e5f4ee4afc2e800c444bbfe>:0

  at FlightFinder.Client.Components.Shortlist.BuildRenderTree (:59912/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.RenderTree.RenderTreeBuilder builder) <0x1e07e88 + 0x00058> in <5589bddb96e64f64bb0e27875fbeec39>:0

  at Blazor.Fluxor.Feature`1[TState].set_State (:59912/TState value) <0x1b1c510 + 0x00056> in <23c61ea74e5f4ee4afc2e800c444bbfe>:0

Issues.Title: Blazor tooling crashes VS after pasting code with doc type
Issues.Body:
Original issue: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/294284/visual-studio-crashes-after-pasting-cshtml-content.html?childToView=297537

### Repro
1. Clone https://github.com/dcb99/WebApplication5.git
2. Open solution and past the following into `_Layout.cshtml` (to override the current contents): `<!DOCTYPE html>`
3. VS crashes with the following exception:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2008729/43017143-f26a94a2-8c09-11e8-8c17-eb3169a4eef4.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Blazor tooling crashes VS after pasting code with doc type" (#1160)

Issues.Title: SVG can't load image
Issues.Body:
I am trying to load image inside svg. 
I want my canvas based [clock component](https://lupusablazordemos.azurewebsites.net/) to rewrite on svg and compare results.

I was generating svg tags inside blazor component, for now all tested svg elements are working properly, only image has problem.

Blazor not displays expected image, in index.html it is loading normally, in index.cshtml not.

For test I tried this [example](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/image#Example) from mozilla:
```
<svg width=200 height=200 
     xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" 
     xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">       
  <image xlink:href="https://mdn.mozillademos.org/files/6457/mdn_logo_only_color.png" height="200" width="200"/>    
</svg>
```

### **On image we can see that the same code snippet is working outside blazor and doesn't work inside.**
The same in all my browsers (firefox, chome, edge).


![untitled1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40779557/42970069-47806302-8b76-11e8-87c2-431c65aea32d.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SVG can't load image" (#1158)

Issues.Title: Component constructor injection
Issues.Body:
I would love it if Blazor would allow constructor injection when composing components with base classes that requires injection of services (to make the DI system more consistent with how it works when composing services).

If this is a feature you would consider I would not mind creating a PR with the functionality to help out
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Component constructor injection" (#1159)

Issues.Title: Fixed exporting platform to window object
Issues.Body:
Recently versions are not exporting platform to window object correctly.
When GlobalExports.ts gets called, platform from Enviroment.ts is undefined and gets set only when Environment.setPlatform(monoPlatform) is called on boot.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fixed exporting platform to window object" (#1157)

Issues.Title: Publish failing
Issues.Body:
Hi, I'm trying to publish a blazolib and I'm getting this error.
```
 error : The assembly at obj/Debug/netstandard2.0/BlazorFileReader.dll has no specified entry point.
```
As project OutputType is Library, the assembly is not suppose to have an entry point.

Steps:
```
$ dotnet new blazorlib -o mylib
// Replace RegisteredFunction.Invoke to JSRuntime.Current.InvokeAsync
//Update packages to 0.5.0-preview1-10349
$ dotnet publish -c Debug

Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 15.7.179.6572 for .NET Core
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

  Restore completed in 30.69 ms for /mnt/docs/dev/dotnet-playground/BlazorComponents/BlazorFileReader/BlazorFileReader.csproj.
  Restore completed in 62.85 ms for /mnt/docs/dev/dotnet-playground/BlazorComponents/BlazorFileReader/BlazorFileReader.csproj.
  BlazorFileReader -> /mnt/docs/dev/dotnet-playground/BlazorComponents/BlazorFileReader/bin/Debug/netstandard2.0/BlazorFileReader.dll
  Blazor Build result -> 0 files in /mnt/docs/dev/dotnet-playground/BlazorComponents/BlazorFileReader/bin/Debug/netstandard2.0/dist
EXEC : error : The assembly at obj/Debug/netstandard2.0/BlazorFileReader.dll has no specified entry point. [/mnt/docs/dev/dotnet-playground/BlazorComponents/BlazorFileReader/BlazorFileReader.csproj]
     at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Build.BootJsonWriter.GetAssemblyEntryPoint(String assemblyPath) in /_/src/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Build/Core/BootJsonWriter.cs:line 56
     at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Build.BootJsonWriter.WriteFile(String assemblyPath, String[] assemblyReferences, String[] embeddedResourcesSources, Boolean linkerEnabled, String outputPath) in /_/src/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Build/Core/BootJsonWriter.cs:line 24
     at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Build.Cli.Commands.WriteBootJsonCommand.<>c__DisplayClass0_0.<Command>b__0() in /_/src/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Build/Cli/Commands/WriteBootJsonCommand.cs:line 57
/home/tony/.nuget/packages/microsoft.aspnetcore.blazor.build/0.5.0-preview1-10349/targets/Blazor.MonoRuntime.targets(635,5): error MSB3073: The command "dotnet "/home/tony/.nuget/packages/microsoft.aspnetcore.blazor.build/0.5.0-preview1-10349/targets/../tools/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Build.dll" write-boot-json obj/Debug/netstandard2.0/BlazorFileReader.dll --references "/mnt/docs/dev/dotnet-playground/BlazorComponents/BlazorFileReader/obj/Debug/netstandard2.0/blazor/bootjson-references.txt" --embedded-resources"/mnt/docs/dev/dotnet-playground/BlazorComponents/BlazorFileReader/obj/Debug/netstandard2.0/blazor/embedded.resources.txt"  --output "/mnt/docs/dev/dotnet-playground/BlazorComponents/BlazorFileReader/obj/Debug/netstandard2.0/blazor/blazor.boot.json"" exited with code 1. [/mnt/docs/dev/dotnet-playground/BlazorComponents/BlazorFileReader/BlazorFileReader.csproj]
```

Dev environment:
```
blazor version: 0.5.0-preview1-10349

$ dotnet --info
SDK do .NET Core (refletindo qualquer global.json):
 Version:   2.1.302
 Commit:    9048955601

Ambiente de tempo de execuÃ§Ã£o:

Another text

to Counter.cshtml. regards Uwe

Issues.Title: One single route is reported as 'The following routes are ambiguous'
Issues.Body:
I repeatedly get errors such as this:

`Error: System.InvalidOperationException: Failed to compare two elements in the array. --->` `System.InvalidOperationException: The following routes are ambiguous:`
`'admin/product/{ProductUrl}' in 'X.Client.AdminWide.UpdateProduct'`
`'admin/product/{ProductUrl}' in 'X.Client.AdminWide.UpdateProduct'`

I have only one route 'admin/product/{ProductUrl}' in that page. Also, that page has been working for a while, but only shows that errors after I create a new page with a dynamic url ("/user/{UserName}/orders"), which really has nothing related to it.

The error only happens if the url is like "/admin/product" and doesn't happen when it's "/admin".

The oddest thing is, *sometimes* I would edit the route of a wholly unrelated page into "/x/y" and a random other page would break.

What could be the case here?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "One single route is reported as 'The following routes are ambiguous'" (#1151)

Issues.Title: Polyfill for TextDecoder
Issues.Body:
I was toying around with server side blazor and the first culprit i run into was the lack of Edge support ðŸ˜‰ 
I've extracted the least amount of Polyfil necessary from https://github.com/samthor/fast-text-encoding/blob/master/text.js#L137 which worked for my experiments and still uses the native TextDecoder in other browsers.
Not sure if this is acceptable or how / where i need to attribute this.

Fixes #1131
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Polyfill for TextDecoder" (#1150)

Issues.Title: Any plans to support System.Drawing.Common?
Issues.Body:
Maybe it is not so important to have this support on early development phase, but it's interesting if it can be supported and how high importance will it have.

It is based on mono, so maybe can be easy implemented.

https://www.nuget.org/packages/System.Drawing.Common
https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Windows.Compatibility
https://github.com/CoreCompat/CoreCompat

![untitled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40779557/42899160-2852c026-8a93-11e8-9425-ce7b5c7ec947.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Any plans to support System.Drawing.Common?" (#1149)

Issues.Title: CPU High issue report
Issues.Body:
I made a sample project to reproduce this problem.  Please check this out: https://github.com/doggy8088/TodoMVC_Blazor/tree/CPUHighBug

After clone my code, switch to `CPUHighBug` branch.  Open with Visual Studio 2017, then hit `Ctrl+F5`, then you will see the CPU high problem in Chrome.

If you need to turn off the Tab in Chrome, please hit `Shift+ESC` to open **Chrome Task Manager**, then Close the high cpu tab.

Issues.Title: Add HTML Block rewriting
Issues.Body:
/cc @SteveSandersonMS - handing this off for you to do the runtime piece.

Rewrites HTML-only subtrees of the IR in an HTML 'block' node with simple string content. 

This will rely on new runtime/rendertree support in order to work E2E.

Issues.Title: Redirecting between pages (parent> child) but UI is not updating
Issues.Body:
Not sure if this is a bug or if I'm using it the wrong way. Let me try and explain what I'm trying to do. 

**In the Vue world**
Typically I would have the following components: 

- **App** (the main component page with a ```router-view```)
- - **List** (a component with a list of items and a  ```router-view```)
- - - **Create** (a component with the create details on)

This means I could deep link into the create page i.e.

- root.com/items (The list of items)
- root.com/items/create (This list of items with the create dialog visible)

Navigating between the two pages would simply show / hide the create section

e.g. **root.com/items**
```
-------------------------
| Item A | Create | Edit | 
| Item B | Create | Edit | 
| Item B | Create | Edit | 
-------------------------
```
e.g. **root.com/items/create**
```
-------------------------
|                        |
| Name:     ======       |
| Type:      ======      |
|                        |
| Item A | Create | Edit | 
| Item B | Create | Edit | 
| Item B | Create | Edit | 
-------------------------
```

**In the Blazor world**

I tried the same in Blazor. The only way to achieve the nested routing was to have the following: 

- MainLayout (inherits from BlazorLayoutComponent)
- - List Page (Has a page directive with the url "/" and inherits from BlazorLayoutComponent)
- - - Create Page (Has a page directive with the url "/create")

I have a link on each page linking between them i.e. ```list``` -> ```new``` and ```new``` -> ```list```. 

**The bug**

When I go from the ```list``` page to the ```new``` page, the control shows and everything is fine, however when I navigate back, the UI does not update. The URL does update, just not the UI.

Is this type of nested routing supported in Blazor? Is it a future consideration? The multi-level child routing in Vue is pretty cool and would be good to see some of this in Blazor ðŸ˜„ 

Thanks and shout if it's not clear. 
G
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Redirecting between pages (parent> child) but UI is not updating" (#1145)

Issues.Title: Blank page when running preview app
Issues.Body:
Downloaded the latest Blazor Language Services from [here](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=aspnet.blazor) and have gone through the official guide for getting things going.

The example app, upon starting a new asp.net blazor project, just shows 'Loading...' in the top left corner, then eventually ends with a white screen.

This happens in Firefox and IE, both on the latest versions.

Help!

Cheers.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Blank page when running preview app" (#1144)

Issues.Title: Cannot call a method without parameters from JavaScript to C#
Issues.Body:
When I try to call a method without parameters:

```
var method = Blazor.platform.findMethod("TransactionTypeCreator.Client",
                "TransactionTypeCreator.Client.Services",
                "AppState",
                "UploadInput");

Blazor.platform.callMethod(method, null, null);
```

I get an error in MonoPlatform.ts (line 51): 
`if (args.length > 4) {     <- Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of null`

Why do I need to pass parameters?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cannot call a method without parameters from JavaScript to C#" (#1143)

Issues.Title: Visual Studio for mac not supported
Issues.Body:
Apparently  Visual Studio for Mac doesn't Support C# 7.3 thus not able to build a blazor app.

Dotnet 2.1.300 installed (and possible to build/run blazor apps on mac via CLI), but Visual Studio For Mac is not. 

`Error: CSC : error CS1617: Invalid option '7.3' for /langversion. Use '/langversion:?' to list supported values.`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Visual Studio for mac not supported" (#1138)

Issues.Title: Improve js interop with dynamic content execution
Issues.Body:
My experimental [project](http://lupusablazordemos.azurewebsites.net/) is working **very slow** right now.

So I think about optimization strategies and hope will achieve better performance. This strategies are different but I think this one is interesting not only for my project.

I am using **canvas** and manipulating it via js interop, it means I do heavy operations with interop, many calls, passing parameters, maintain large code etc.

Let's imagine I have **30 js registered function** (draw line, rect, arc etc) and mixing them (as will be required from projects logic) and let's say I **100 times** call, pass parameters, receive results from/to js. And it is repeating on every redraw (one second or less interval for smooth clock)!

This 30 js functions are like underlying level to access html5 canvas, it can be also referenced nuget package.

All this actions: call, passing params, return results have **time cost** and **probably is one reason for slow performance**.

So this question popups logically - can we reduce calls amount? For example collect all js functions and **call one time all this commands**.

I think it is possible, because js allows us (with many ways) to **evalute code** (execute string containing js script).

So I can use string builder, collect all necessary js logic and call it one time. Please note that in most case **I don't need results from js**, if I need only to pass in another js function.

As I mentioned there is **many ways** to execute dynamic js scripts, first option is **evil()** function but I don't want now to go in details with way is better.
I did **small research** and there can be found optimal way to do this (technique not matters for now).
There are security, debuging, preformance issues but let's forget about them for now.

I try to **model theoretical structure** to improve js interop, it to become more dynamic and interoperable. Because as it seems we can't escape from js for next months/years and we need to find ways to use it in efficient way.

We can make parallel to **sql queries**, where we can build any query and then server will execute it.

Ok, I think it sounds good, less js functions, less calls, more flexibility and custom approach.
No one denies me to do it myself, maybe not perfectly but to try :)

**Why I open this issue?**
 First I want to hear what people think about this;
 Second I think this improvement  (if it has sense) not should do all developers separately, we can say that someone will implement it and share as nuget package, but I think it's better to do blazor itself because we expect **more competentive people** in blazor team, **built-in feature** will be better and community always can contribute any improvement.

I will be happy if you think about this and measure does it have perspective or not, is this no sense or **real way for some improvement**.

Hope text is understandable, for now it is **only theoretical** but if there will be interes or I will do it myself I will share my code and results about performance.

Thank you, **waiting for your activity** :)

I know there are many open issues and many things to think and to do, but IMHO this issue can be useful too.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Improve js interop with dynamic content execution" (#1134)

Issues.Title: Minify blazor.server.js
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Minify blazor.server.js" (#1136)

Issues.Title: empty sreen
Issues.Body:
At first I'm not very familiar with all these things but interested.
I tried this:
https://blazor.net/docs/get-started.html
At Point 4 the browser opened: Loading ... Then an empty screen.
I can't find any error messages.
I have installed Visual Studio Community (Windows 10 Pro 1803)  and Blazor today.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "empty sreen" (#1137)

Issues.Title: WebSockets support
Issues.Body:
There is this issue #20 tracking SignalR client support.

I am opening this to follow a standard client WebSockets implementation. Maybe it comes from Mono making `System.Net.WebSockets` available, a separate package/api using JavaScript interop or a new API for Blazor.

Is there any projection on this already?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WebSockets support" (#1135)

Issues.Title: Change standalone web.config to use Cache-Control headers
Issues.Body:
I published updated [project](http://lupusablazordemos.azurewebsites.net) to azure.
When I navigate to site Chrome was showing old version, Firefox got error. Edge showed new version but I am not sure there was loaded and cashed previous version.
**I manually cleared browsers cache**, Chrome and Firefox downloaded updated files and run site as expected.

Of course we need user to see new version for after all new publishing.

Should I trigger this somehow from my code or should blazor do it automatically?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Change standalone web.config to use Cache-Control headers" (#1133)
